page.title: 19Travel in Warton Area
page.content: There are fine road and rail links north & south. Rail is 1.25m away via Millhead and serves North Lancs, West Yorkshire, Furness, Scotland & London. Roads to the East remain little changed in 60 years and journeys are slow by comparison. The M6 & A6 run parallel. 76.1% of Warton homes have at least 1 car. 2.8% have 3 or more. In Millhead 56% of old homes and 95% of new have a car. Buses serve Lancaster, Silverdale, Arnside & Kendal. Others on the A6 run to the Lakes. Half a mile from Millhead Express coaches can be boarded for Scotland, Manchester and London. The canal is used for pleasure boats until blocked by the M6 north of Tewitfield locks. Bicycles are in 39% of homes. 12.8% have motorbikes. All candidates trained in 1985 by the School Assoc. gained the National Cycling Proficiency Cert.
